titleStmt.title: J. G. Wilson et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2141

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Louisville Ky
July 18th 1865
This Excellency
Tho. E. Bramlette

We take pleasure in recommending to your Excellency James P. Harbeson for the vacancy in the office of Judge of the City Court of Louisville. He is well fitted for the position. He has been practicing law in this city as the partner of Hon Tho A Marshall. We would be much gratified with his appointment

J. G. Wilson
James A. Beattie
Jno K Goodloe
Jno W. Barr
Wolfe & Hays
Bodley & Simrall
G P Arbegast
J. Guthrie Coke
Saml Russell,
Thos R Sinton
R M Cunningham
W. L. Breckinridge Jr.
F S J Ronald
D Spalding Jr
Wm E Glover
John G. Baxter
Wm Sample
Isaac Caldwell
Names
Joseph B. Read
J. H. Ward
Baird & Price
Sam B. Smith
Chas. P. Rudd
C Ripley
W. R. Thompson
James Guthrie
Phillip Speed.

City Judge of Louisville
Jas P. Harbeson
apptd
18 July 1865
